intro: Copaifera glabra, commonly known as the smooth copaiba, is a species of tree native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant is notable for its aromatic resin, which has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties. Copaifera glabra typically grows in humid lowland forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
